# Forecasting Lab: Forecasting and Workflow
Resolving issues after the have become a problem is cool, but what if we could predict issues and take preventative actions? 
* Create a notebook for disk forecast
* Create a workflow to notify us with Dynatrace Problem Tickets and Slack before disk space runs out

grail.canonicalQuery:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, avg(dt.host.disk.free)
| filter dt.entity.host == "HOST-E9A604AAF6626DC7"
| fields `avg(dt.host.disk.free)`, dt.entity.host, interval, timeframe

metrics.description: Percentage of free space available for user in file system. On Linux and AIX it is % of free space available for unprivileged user. It doesn't contain part of free space reserved for the root.

sections.title: Forecasting Lab: Extra Example -  Since there's not a lot of change in our disk metric, here's an example with CPU.

grail.canonicalQuery:
timeseries by:{dt.entity.host}, avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)
| filter dt.entity.host == "HOST-E9A604AAF6626DC7"
| fields `avg(dt.host.cpu.usage)`, dt.entity.host, interval, timeframe
